lines.gurmukhi: AwNDry kau sbd suriq kr cr tyk bhrY crn kr diRsit sbd hY
lines.transliteration_english: Aandharay Kau Sabad Surati Kar Char Tayka , Baharai Charan Kar Drisati Sabad Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: A blind person has support of the words, ability to hear, hands and feet. A deaf has much reliance on his hands feet, vision of the eyes and the words that he speaks.

lines.gurmukhi: gUMgY tyk cr kr diRsit sbd suriq ilv lUly tyk diRsit sbd sRuiq pd hY
lines.transliteration_english: Goongai Tayk Char Kar Drisati Sabad Surati Liva , Loolay Tayk Drisati Sabad Srouti Pad Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: A dumb has support of ears for listening, feet, hands vision of the eyes. A handless person relies much on eyes speech, hearing and feet.

lines.gurmukhi: pwgury kau tyk diRsit sbd suriq kr tyk eyk eyk AMg hIn dInqw ACd hY
lines.transliteration_english: Paagury Kau Tayk Drisati Sabad Surati Kara , Tayk Ayk Ayk Ang Heen Deenataa Achhad Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: One who is lame or without legs rely on sight of his eyes speech, ability to hear, and use of his hands. Despite capacitated of one limb or faculty, the dependence on others remain hidden.

lines.gurmukhi: AMD guMg suMn pMg luMj duK puMj mm AMqr ky AMqrjwmI prbIn sd hY ]314]
lines.transliteration_english: Andh Goung Sounn Pang Lounj Doukh Pounj Mama , Antar Kay Antarajaamee Parabeen Sad Hai ?314?

Shabad OS B.translation: But I am blind, dumb, deaf, maimed of hand and feet a mass of suffering. 0 my True Lord! You are the wisest and completely informed of all my innate pains. 0 My Lord, please be merciful and remove all my pains. (314)
